The Tiruchi Kendra of the Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan would host a three-day music, dance and drama festival, ‘Kalaiyurum Kaviri 2016,’ at the Kalai Kaviri College of Fine Arts in the city from January 22. The even is part of the Bhavan’s attempt to foster budding talent with the support of Infosys Foundation. The first day’s event would feature a dance programme by students of Srividya Sundaresan. A flute concert by M.Anirudh and a vocal duet by Aishwarya Madhavan and Padmashree would be held on Saturday. On Sunday, A Rohith would present a keyboard concert and it would be followed by a drama, ‘Malarum Manitham,’ by Arumai Kalai Kariyalayam of A.Patric and Troupe, according to a press release from J.T.Chari, Director-projects, Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan, Tiruchi.

AMMA camps

Camps under the Assured Maximum Service to Marginalised People in All Villages Scheme will be held at the following places in the district on Friday:

Ariyamangalam, Thamalavarupayam, Chinthamani, Keezha Kalkandarkottai, Thorakudi, Inamreddiyapatti, Azhagapuri, Viragalur, Poonampalayam, Serukudi, Kottaiyur and Seelaipillaiyarpudur.

Residents can avail the services of the Revenue Department at the camp, Collector K.S.Palanisamy said in a press release.
title: Dance and drama festival
